4. "I have reviewed the report and found that it was not his fault. I have told the law enforcement officers that if journalists are doing their work, give a fair warning first.

If it isn't his or her fault, the journalist was getting an interview and such, do not issue a fine."

3. Meanwhile, Khairy has ordered for a RM1,000 fine against a Sin Chew Daily journalist to be cancelled. 

The journalist was compunded yesterday for allegedly violating SOPs when covering the nomination process of candidates contesting the Larkin state seat in Johor Bahru.

2. "But, I also have to say this. There are times when people watch a video and jump to conclusions blaming the leaders who are present at the location.

I'm not talking about this particular incident alone, but in general, where the ones who caused the commotion are the public."
